alert.note: Alert for Stanton; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:18AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wayne and northeastern Stanton Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 417 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Hoskins, or 11 miles east of Norfolk, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wayne and northeastern Stanton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
